en: Unknown Man, formerly called Edward, Baron Herbert of Cherbury

The yellow tone of the lace in this miniature, achieved with lead-tin yellow, is unusual, however the micrograph images show how the pale yellow paint is added on top of an existing lace pattern in white. It is notable, on comparison with other Oliver miniatures, that the quality (in terms of the consistency and precision of the paint handling) of the execution of the lace in this miniature is less accomplished than other examples more securely attributed to Oliver.

UV and NIR images show retouched areas in the background, which appear light blue and light grey, respectively. 
The monogram is painted on a retouched area, but the gold (Au) MA-XRF map shows the presence of a monogram (likely original) present underneath.

The pigment palette is consistent with Oliverâ€™s materials and technique, especially regarding the mixtures for the flesh tones and hair. Lips contain vermilion, which is usually not identified after 1610.
